question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable for demonstration. Design a website for me that includes a registration and login system with verification code, capability to automatically play music, with an overall black color scheme and green text.

checklist.title: Is the registration and login system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code implements a complete registration and login system, including user input validation, database interaction, session management, and proper error handling. Score 0 if basic form submission is missing, 5 if only client-side validation exists without server integration, and 10 if the system includes secure password storage (hashing), proper session management, and database connectivity.

checklist.title: Is the verification code functionality properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the verification code system includes: 1) Code generation with appropriate complexity, 2) Visual presentation with sufficient obfuscation, 3) Server-side validation, and 4) Expiration mechanism. Deduct 3 points if the code is too simple (e.g., static or predictable), 3 points if there's no server-side validation, and 4 points if there's no expiration mechanism. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the automatic music playback functionality effectively implemented?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code implements automatic music playback that: 1) Handles autoplay policies correctly (with fallback), 2) Provides user controls for pause/play/volume, 3) Includes a playlist or music selection, and 4) Manages appropriate loading and error states. Deduct 3 points if modern autoplay restrictions aren't addressed, 3 points if basic controls are missing, and 4 points if there's no error handling for unavailable audio files. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the UI fulfill the black and green color scheme requirement?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the implementation properly applies a black background with green text throughout the website with: 1) Consistent application across all pages, 2) Proper contrast ratios for accessibility, 3) Thoughtful application to interactive elements, and 4) Consideration of visual hierarchy. Deduct 3 points if the contrast ratio is below accessibility standards, 3 points if the scheme is inconsistently applied, and 4 points if the result is visually jarring or unreadable. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid form inputs, network issues, authentication failures, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Dynamic background effects that respond to music, 2. Interactive form validation with visual feedback, 3. Custom animated loading indicators matching the theme). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple authentication methods without purpose) 2. Function modules unrelated to the core requirements (e.g., unnecessary social media integrations) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., heavy animations that slow page loading). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating frontend/backend concerns, MVC pattern usage), security practices (XSS prevention, CSRF protection, SQL injection prevention), and code organization. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if security best practices are ignored. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Proper use of the black and green color scheme with appropriate accents 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for poor implementation of the required color scheme, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance for the registration/login process. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during interactions, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
